result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey E Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.  
All applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey E Johnson

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. jbs
on count one.  Defendant's address:  Jeffery L. Johnson #446015, MSDF, PO Box 05911, Milwaukee, WI  53205.
Received & Filed, Original PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing 05/06/2015 by Court Reporter Lisa Weninger.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN. RECORDS 2909 E PARK AVE. CHIPPEWA FALLS, WI 547729
To effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision signed and filed.  File forwarded to Clerk's office for processing.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 19 Judge Cimpl.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5.5 YEARS with 80 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $100 payable to Wilbert K; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jeffrey E Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Jeffrey E Johnson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Jeffrey E Johnson not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Jeffrey E Johnson not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jeffrey E Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Jeffrey E Johnson in custody.  Ron Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Wilbert K.

Defendant Jeffrey E Johnson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Jeffrey E Johnson in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
